title: cmd/gc: stack frame outs area not zeroed by the compiler
body:
Code has recently been added to the gc compiler to explicitly zero pointer containing
locations in the locals area.  The purpose of this zeroing is to prevent the garbage
collector from scanning uninitialized pointers which causes unwanted retention.

This zeroing needs to be extended to cover the outs area as it too can contain
uninitialized values in pointer containing locations.
